intro: Ruschia intrusa, commonly known as the intruding ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually small, clustered, and come in shades of yellow, orange, or red. Ruschia intrusa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance.
